unit: Unit 6 | Inference for Categorical Data: Proportions
title: Marshmallows?
question_text: Clucky Arms Cereal was looking into the proportion of cereal pieces that are marshmallows in each of its cereal boxes.  Researchers came up with a $95\%$ confidence interval of $(0.32, 0.38)$ . Which of the following statements gives the best interpretation of this confidence interval?

choices.text: We are 95 % 95 % confident that the mean number of marshmallows in each box of Clucky Arms Cereal is 35 % 35 % .
We are confident that every box of Clucky Arms Cereal will contain between 32 % 32 % and 38 % 38 % marshmallows as the true population proportion.
We are 95 % 95 % confident that repeated samples of any size will still contain between 32 % 32 % and 38 % 38 % marshmallows.
We are 95 % 95 % confident that every box of Clucky Arms Cereal will contain about one-third marshmallows.
We are 95 % 95 % confident that the interval from 32 % 32 % to 38 % 38 % captures the population proportion of marshmallows in boxes of Clucky Arms Cereal.
